project.teaser: Secure attachment relationships play an important protective role against the intergenerational transmission of social exclusion, not only at early stages, but at all school levels. LET´S CARE aims to comprehensively understand and improve the caring dimension of educational...
project.objective: Secure attachment relationships play an important protective role against the intergenerational transmission of social exclusion, not only at early stages, but at all school levels. LET´S CARE aims to comprehensively understand and improve the caring dimension of educational inclusion and school success. The project main objective is to identify determinants affecting student security as a root cause of underachievement, disengagement and school dropout, at 4 different ecological levels: individual, relational, community and political. LET´S CARE will create a theoretical and practical framework to foster Safe Learning, Safe Teaching, Safe Schools and Safe Education in each level as an approach to break the chain of transgenerational transmission of educational and social exclusion. This approach will generate lower rates of school failure, poor learning outcomes and early school leaving. The main proposal breakthrough is based on considering a relational response to educational exclusion and inequality, resulting in a model for understanding the importance of security to address underachievement and early drop out, and a relational approach to inclusive practices at school that will be translated into tools, recommendations and guidelines for action, from ECEC to secondary and Second Chance schools. A multilevel, multistage and intersectional research, exploring different European educational contexts, will be implemented, including120 schools, 18,000 students, and 2,400 teachers from 6 European countries in 4 schools stages, with special attention to multi-disadvantaged learners. LET´S CARE, supported by a expert consortium, will implement a holistic methodological approach, including cocreation mechanisms, and will translate research findings into political approach, through formulation of novel evidence-based policy recommendations, raising awareness on safe/caring schools, combating social exclusion of disadvantaged learners.
project.title: LET´S CARE: BUILDING SAFE AND CARING SCHOOLS TO FOSTER EDUCATIONAL INCLUSION AND SCHOOL ACHIEVEMENT
project.keywords: Safe education, underachievement, school dropout, disengagement, educational exclusion, secure attachment, safe communities

article.title: Shaping safer and more caring education

result.title: PAR training manual and infographics on PAR activities during project (1)
result.description: Training manual and infographics on PAR activities during the project (M12).The work of the DG will be based on the (PAR) methodology to assess and monitor the project’s tasks and activities throughout the whole project cycle and during the whole duration of the project, putting in place adjustments when necessary to achieve the expected results.

result.title: PAR training manual and infographics on PAR activities during project (2)
result.description: Training manual and infographics on PAR activities during the project (M24).The work of the DG will be based on the (PAR) methodology to assess and monitor the project’s tasks and activities throughout the whole project cycle and during the whole duration of the project, putting in place adjustments when necessary to achieve the expected results.

result.title: Quality Management Plan - review and update
result.description: Report including procedures for Project management, and Quality assurance, updated at M24.

result.title: Reports of the policy makers interaction, incl. PMAB meetings & workshops (1)
result.description: The PMAB will meet in M27 and primarily reflect on the theoretical model design (WP2) and its impact on other deliverables. The report will summarise input by PMAB members and their interaction with project partners.

result.title: Methodological report (1) Qualitative and collaborative data collection
result.description: Methodological report collecting and analyzing:1) In-depth interviews with families with children enrolled in ECEC and/or primary education, located in the communities represented in the LET´S CARE CoS.2) Life histories with NEETS enrolled in second chance schools.3) Semi-structured interviews with key stakeholders at local level (within CoS) and at national level.4) Interviews with policy makers.5) Participatory action research carried out with the teachers participating in the project. In it, a replicable teaching collaboration model in Safe Teaching is elaborated from (a) the results of the focus groups, (b) the Safe Teaching observation tool and (c) the results of the self-observation and observation carried out by the teachers.

result.title: Updating the Structure and members of the DG, CoS and NCB
result.description: D1.10 (M16) Updating the Structure and members of the DG, CoS and NCB :Report describing the structure and members of: 1)DG: composed of 14 members (1/partner) will virtually convene each 4-6 months to provide strategic inputs for all project activities. 2) CoS: 6 local/national school communities, totaling 18 schools, will be the seed of the LET´S CARE CoS. 3) NCB: National Coordinators’ Board or NCB will be created with 2 coordinators per country.

result.title: LET´S CARE Hub platform
result.description: Design and conceptualization of the LETS CARE Hub which is a digital communication and content management platform for project partners and project stakeholders

result.title: Project's website
result.description: The website will be the main starting point for all communication, exploitation, dissemination and upscaling activities. The deliverable will include the project's visual identity to be used for all deliverables. the website will contain information on the project, its public deliverables (with download links when they become available), the partnership, news, external links of related sites, policy, research and practice. It is to be available in M3, updated and maintained throughout the project period, and sustained for a minimum of 5 years after the project ends.

result.title: Dissemination, Communication and Exploitation Yearly reports (1)
result.description: A yearly report on all project activities towards dissemination, communication and exploitation of project results (first year).

result.title: Dissemination, Communication and Exploitation Yearly reports (2)

result.title: Engagement strategy & Qualitative mapping of relevant stakeholders related to the education field at local, national and international level
result.description: This report will describe an engagement plan to maximize the involvement of all types of strategic stakeholders of different types. Besides, it will include a report that identifies different educational stakeholders in each partner country that could potentially benefit from the receiving of the project’s communications. The resulting database will represent the first group of stakeholders that will be invited to and participate in the LET´S CARE hub.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
